website_summaries.verdict: Those with pain in joints like wrists, elbows, and shoulders may prefer this cane's flatter, wider handle.
pros: Flared rubber tips for stability and traction
11 push-button height adjustments fit most people from 5' to 6'5"
Can be rotated for right or left hand
Base is welded on for strength
Comes in a variety of colors
cons: Full-quad cane design makes it heavier than pod-style canes

customer_reviews.title: adjustable, solid, self standing, easy to lean on and use
customer_reviews.text: My 86 year old mom loves this cane. It comes with a clear sticker which is over the holes. The first few days, she complained that it would slip and not stay at the height she had adjusted it to. Upon examining it, we realized the sticker was preventing a locked in type contact, causing it to slip. After removing the clear sticker it has been absolutely perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Shanma in Spokane

customer_reviews.title: Defective Unstable Wobbly feet, Heavy, lowest adjustment is 29"
customer_reviews.text: Others have commented that this cane is wobbly. The one I received is wobbly as well. There seems to be a defect in which one of the legs is bent too much, resulting in it being a bit shorter than the other legs, thus causing it to wobble on hard surfaced floors. Heavy. If the weight of the cane is an issue for you, stay away from this one. Lowest adjustment is 29". I don't know the highest adjustment; I would have to remove the labeling to do that, but this is going to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: C2C

customer_reviews.title: Two of them. Wobbly.
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty upset right now. I ordered this cane several months ago. For several reasons I didn’t use it for about a month. Then I got to the point where I could not safely walk without it. No problem. In my apartment, on carpet, perfect. On hard surfaces though, it is very wobbly. I just dealt with it for a while. Then I decided it wasn’t worth getting hurt because I was too cheap to spend about $25. I ordered a second, and it came today. Once again, wobbly. This one is already in the box for return. No more mail-order canes for me.
customer_reviews.author: SeahawksFan

customer_reviews.title: Beware EXTREMELY WOBBLY AND UNSTABLE
customer_reviews.text: Just received my order I ordered 2 of these and when I took them out of the box I was severely disappointed!!! Extremely wobbly both of them completely unsafe for use my wife will NOT use them cause of how unstable and wobbly they are!! Extremely disappointed!!!! The rubber caps are awful and different sizes, Unsafe, unsafe unsafe!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ficara

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my mom
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my elderly mom after she broke her knee. Prior to the purchase of this cane, she'd been shuffling along on a walker and was disinclined to move more than absolutely required. After the arrival of the cane, she ditched the walker in a heartbeat and now moves around with alacrity. She finds it easy to use, and the quad base has not been a problem or a trip hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Aldne Now

customer_reviews.title: Raising cane !!!
customer_reviews.text: How can I rave about a cane? Who knew I'd be using them with these bad knees?. The smaller sized quad foot is best, in order to avoid tripping. Check with med. professionals to ensure they agree this style is safe to use. Very few PT's and M.D.'s seem to recognize how terrific the handles are for all styles of the Hugo cane line. That handle can really make it much easier to grasp with comfort. Pretty colors, too.
customer_reviews.author: mary customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it sells as.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. But honestly if I had to buy it again I'd get a regular cane, not the 4-tip. It's harder to walk with than I expected. But I think it's an issue of the 4 little prongs rather than 1 solid one, and it works as designed, I think I just chose the wrong design for helping walk during my medical recovery. The cane itself is very lightweight but strong, pretty easy to adjust length.
customer_reviews.author: P Gaenir

customer_reviews.title: Cane is not stable and hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: This four footed cane does not sit level. It teeters and tips because one of the feet is about 1/4" off from the other 3. I would like to return this item for a refund. My wife just got out of the hospital after a 30 day stay, started using this item and does not like it. This item is made primarily for a right handed person and she is left handed . It is also rather unstable since it does not sit on the floor properly. We want to return it for a refund. Thanks for your attention to this matter.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Voils

customer_reviews.title: Strong, sturdy, adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: Quad cane (4 legs) is stable, and stands upright by itself. Strong and sturdy. Tip: can be used for either a right handed person or a lefty. Base legs are shaped like letter K. Rotate the cane bottom part, so it clicks in place with the flat part of the K beside your primary side. Eg, for righties, flat part of K is by your right leg. For lefties, flat part of K by your left leg. Tip: handle height should be about the level of your wrist. Too low and you stoop. Too high and your arm is not optimal for body support (and will get tired).
customer_reviews.author: Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: I was quite disappointed by this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was quite disappointed by this purchase. If you look closely you will see it has four legs which I needed after hip replacement surgery. It came with only 3 caps for the 4 legs. I sent 2 emails requesting the 4th cap as this cane is useless without it. I received no reply and had to spend additional money going to a drugstore to purchase 4 more caps. Very dissatisfied with this product and the lack of compassion and follow up service.
customer_reviews.author: gail collins

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: Not safe for those who needs to walk up and down the stairs.. The base is too big.... My mom will stick with the other hugo quad cane. Also if your loved ones walk with cane right in front. They will also at risk of tripping and falling over.. I guess if you need that much support..it is best to use a walker
customer_reviews.author: Fam3��

customer_reviews.title: Seems safer than my regular lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This cane has just a little more weight to it and feels much safer. I feel I can step more safely off a curb with this model. The little extra weight seems to keep me from slipping. I may buy another just like it for the car. Also like the fact that it stands alone much better than the other stand alone models. Very nice color too; I got the pink.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline T. Moulder

customer_reviews.title: This thing is wobbly
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this cane in hopes that it would help me to transition from a walker to an ordinary walking cane. So far it hasn't helped. The problem is that it wobbles. All four feet don't rest on the floor at the same time. There's a gap of maybe a millimeter or two between one of them and the floor when the other three are down. This translates into more lateral movement of the handle than I feel comfortable with.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and stands up by itself
customer_reviews.text: This is my second cane from this company. I like that the base is small and that it can be used by right-handed or left-handed people. Also, when the rubber tips on the quad wear down, there are very reasonable replacements. Stands up to being tipped over accidentally or dropped. My favorite feature is that since it's a quad base, it stands on its own. No more picking up the cane off the floor and it's easy to get to.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Elsberry

customer_reviews.title: Wobbily base
customer_reviews.text: This cane is not as stable as it should be. I want to return it but window had closed. Tried to adjust the 4 leg tip and now can't get the screw back in. I was in hospital and really didn't get a chance to use it as I was using my walker. If company views this... Plz contact me ..would like a different cane with a smaller base! I am not looking for a refund just a different cane Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Oceanbreeze

customer_reviews.title: Brother has stability!!!
customer_reviews.text: My brother is partially paralyzed from a brain injury and I wanted to get him up and moving instead of staying in wheelchair being only 43 years old. I brought the regular cane and he kept stumbling so I purchased the quad and he don’t even get in the wheelchair anymore! Saves my back because now I can leave it in the truck and take him out more because he’s able to walk to the truck and we only use the wheelchair when he has to walk farther than he does around the house. He feels a bit of normalcy in his life with the independence this cane gives him.
customer_reviews.author: June

customer_reviews.title: The handle is not cushioned so it's uncomfortable if you must bear down heavily in order to walk
customer_reviews.text: The handle is not very soft and hurts my hand. I have to wrap it and still the protruding edges on both sides of the handle bother me. It's a hard plastic material and may hold up longer but is not very comfortable. It may be ok for some but I have to bear down heavily for support. Also this cane creeks as I walk. My last cane started to creek like that after 10 years & that was just before the welding broke.
customer_reviews.author: Josey Miller

customer_reviews.title: In fact I took 2 bad falls and had to have the fire department pick ...
customer_reviews.text: Just had a knee replaced and when it was time for me to transition from a walker to a cane, a friend lent me hers. It felt wobbly and I was quite insecure. In fact I took 2 bad falls and had to have the fire department pick me up from the floor. Terribly embarrassing!! My PT lent me this cane and I liked it so much, I immediately ordered one. Now I feel secure and there have been no more falls
customer_reviews.author: ccondesa

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and a kittl weighty
customer_reviews.text: I had to use this for a little while after injuring my foot, and it was very helpful for me keeping pressure off my foot. It allowed me to get around a lot more! I chose it specifically for it's stability because I am accident prone and tend to fall easily. I would certainly recommend! It does have a bit of weight to it with the additional support feature at the bottom so anyone too weak might have trouble with it. It's not extensive, though.
customer_reviews.author: Rach

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly - Not stable or safe
customer_reviews.text: Received this cane and immediately sent it back. It is defective and very wobbly. The feet are not level and when standing on its own, they do not all touch the ground. Extremely disappointed as I was looking for something to help me as I transition from crutches after surgery. But this would not be safe to use as it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Doe

customer_reviews.title: LO-PROFILE AND LIGHTWEIGHT
customer_reviews.text: DUE TO AN UNFORTUNATE ACCIDENT, HUGO AND I HAVE BECOME INSEPARABLE THESE LAST SEVERAL MONTHS, BUT HE IS WORTH EVERY CENT I PAID FOR HIM. IF I TRY TO GO TOO FAST, STABILITY IS COMPROMISED (MORE MY FAULT PERHAPS), BUT THIS IS SO MUCH BETTER THAN A REGULAR CANE. IF YOU NEED HELP, GET A HUGO, YOU WON'T BE SORRY!!
customer_reviews.author: LEWKW

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Ads in glaring paint
customer_reviews.text: I spent half an hour gently scraping off the blatant advertising on both side of the cane shaft, probably have to go over the cane with auto polish. These are not little manufacturers labels, they are about 4 inches long and go a third of the way around the shaft (both sides) in glaring white paint on a black cane. If Hugo insists on ignoring their customers complaints over this label I won't be buying another of their products. When I went over all the reviews over a third complained about these labels, should have read them all before I bought. The cane itself seems good; sturdy, feet are level and the handle is quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Aliano

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to a friend as a gift. I have noticed she has almost fallen several times, as she gets off balance. This came is sturdy and has four legs to help with balance. She had said she would never use a cane as they are not pretty. This one is bright pink, her favorite color, and she loves it. She said it is making such a big difference in her life. Now she is not afraid she is going to fall. So thankful for this great product.
customer_reviews.author: lynn T.

customer_reviews.title: May work for balance but not for support while an injury heals
customer_reviews.text: I'm recovering from a grade three ankle sprain. I've graduated to a walking frame, something to lessen the weight on my bad ankle for each step. I thought maybe I could move on to a cane but it's not working out. I'm 5' - 4" and about 112 pounds and thought the small base cane would be enough, it is not. The cane wants to tip to the left or right and is useless outside in grass. I think if you need a cane for minor balance problems this may work but if you are needing support to lessen the load on an injured foot or ankle or knee this is not stable enough.
customer_reviews.author: Grandavia

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 10 days.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Hugo Adjustable Quad Cane on November 10, 2017. Today is 18 days later. I probably used it for 10 days for very short amounts of time. 2 of the rubber tips fell off 2 days ago when I was out. We recovered 1 but 1 is gone. I have searched for replacements even on the Hugo site with no luck. The cane is not stable as it is. A waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Kell

customer_reviews.title: Quad canes are great for stability
customer_reviews.text: I have to carry multiple items with me wherever I go. The quad can stand on its own when I need two hands to adjust the carry items. When I go to places that don’t have electric carts I often use a rollater., but when I expect an electric cart I’ll use my quad cane. If I have my rollator I can’t use an electric cart and am forced to walk. The cane fits easily in the electric cart. In the house the quad cane helps me keep my balance while being easy to set to the side when not needed.
customer_reviews.author: PetRescuer

customer_reviews.title: Wonky
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the cane wobbles (even when the rubber feet were replaced). We bought this in anticipation of needing it once mom was "upgraded" from her wide-base quad cane. Now that she can use it.. we realize that it wobbles and cannot be used. Of course.. now we are out of the return window.
customer_reviews.author: AKM

customer_reviews.title: Stable on stairs
customer_reviews.text: I like the maroon color. Cane has been really great on stairs if you use the correct side (need to turn handle to have larger part of feet away from you) Much more stable than regular cane
customer_reviews.author: Suzetka

customer_reviews.title: Holds you up in the ocean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my GF who had hip replacement surgery. Specifically bought it for her to use on the beach because it would offer more stability then a rivalry cane. It works great, she used it on the beach and in the ocean! It did get a little heavy once it filled with water, but it worked exactly as we intended it to!! Sturdy and strong!! Can’t beat it!!
customer_reviews.author: Trakwrkr

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy quad Cane and lovely Rose color!
customer_reviews.text: This cane is perfect for someone who needs extra security and stability when walking and the handle is very comfortable to hold plus the color is beautiful! but they should tell you what kind of cane tips go with the product so you can purchase the right ones! Thank You! Rose
customer_reviews.author: R. M. Torres

customer_reviews.title: Very Wobbly & Heavy
customer_reviews.text: This can is so wobbly is actually sends me off balance & has become more of a hazard than a help. I would have returned it immediately if we hadn’t accidentally thrown away the box. To be fair, the make seems to be of a good quality & build otherwise & I do like the color. Disappointed that it’s useless & hazardous for me.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Steward

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my mom and she likes this one better then the Drive version she was using
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my mom and she likes this one better then the Drive version she was using. It feels more stable and It's so much easier to adjust. Only down side so far is we had a really hard time getting the plastic wrap off the handle. I'm not sure why there is so much plastic but it seems like a waste of materials when it came in a bag.
customer_reviews.author: Rabb

customer_reviews.title: Love the color but handle is defective! It has black smudge marks all over the pink.
customer_reviews.text: Love cane and that it stands on its own but it looks old because of the dirty handle. It came beautifully packaged and wrapped so I know this is an error. I don’t want to send it back. Can you just send me a new pink handle so it looks new. I bought the pink because I kept forgetting my black cane everywhere I went. I won’t forget with a pink cane. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Too wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend!!! Wiggles to much when you walk with it, much harder to wall than without it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT a cocoa color!
customer_reviews.text: While the quality and design are indeed as pictured the “Cocoa” color is almost non-existent. The only thing cocoa is the soft grip handle. The rest of the cane is a very dark brown-black and black. Very dissatisfied as I specifically chose “Cocoa” to get away from a dark color and instead received this. Due to my urgent desire to leave a walker behind and transition to a cane, I will keep this purchase but if you’re hoping for a specific color I wouldn’t recommend purchasing from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: kpm

customer_reviews.title: All the health problems my poor my mom has this has been a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and quality and extremely great price as far as my experience with the product. 5****STAR Product My mom has a curved spine and osteoporosis and mother time is catching up with her and it saddens me and leaves me in tears barely being able to see her walk but this thing has been a miracle saver and helps allot with her balance an she's able to walk
customer_reviews.author: Thesaved1one

customer_reviews.title: Therapist prefers regular cane
customer_reviews.text: I bought after hip surgery to graduate from my walker. After buying, I found my physical therapist did not like these with large prongs. He prefers I use a regular cane. But it is pretty well made - I find these 4-prong models to be a little wobbly though.
customer_reviews.author: DeeD

customer_reviews.title: Highly Disappointed!! BUYER BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE ITS UNSTABLE!! I read the reviews and saw the 4.5 star rating on this product and decided to purchase the Rose colored cane. I received the cane today and was HIGHLY disappointed. The cane is unbelievably wobbly and unstable. I needed it because I had knee surgery, I could only imagine if an elderly person tried to use this. SAVE your money!! It's absolutely not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Nice cane. Handle color not as shown; very bright
customer_reviews.text: Fairly light weight and comfortable to use. Easy to adjust the height. The cane itself is a nice rose color. However, the handle is a bright eye-poppng pink. Not at all as in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: M Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Nice lilac color, nice and stable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for an elderly friend, who has been using it without any difficulties. The color is a nice shade of lilac, which I think most women would like, though men might not find it very manly. It's sturdy and has worked well. I noticed that the cane is wrapped in a tight protective tube of plastic wrap which is not easy to remove, and you will probably need a young person with a certain amount of dexterity to peel it off. And you will need to peel it off in order to adjust the height of the cane. So be prepared to have someone help if you are an elderly person with limited dexterity or vision.
customer_reviews.author: AHW

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it’s wobbly
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. Really want to like this cane. Nice look. Lightweight and stands alone. Unfortunately the minority reviews that called cane “wobbly” are spot on. I have wood floors and it is just not stable. As mentioned the legs aren’t all angled properly and it just doesn’t feel safe. Also the handle is not comfortable to me at all. I feel like I would end up with calluses. Returning tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Jayla’s Mom

customer_reviews.title: Really a great cane for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Made in China, so not sure how much longer it will be available. Had a hard time finding anything similar made in the usa or canada. Fits short people well. Would buy again or recommend to a friend. Well engineered and well manufactured. Sturdy and light. Hopefully it was not made with prison labor or slaves.
customer_reviews.author: j p.

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the cocoa one for my Grandpa, and he received the rose colored one. May not seem like a big deal, but Grandpa is a manly man, not a sissy. Pink isn't his color. Plus, we had it shipped to his home three states away, so a return isn't feasible.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Whealton

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Nice looking quad cane
customer_reviews.text: My mother has an old aluminum cane, but I wanted to have an extra one around her house. This one is very nice looking, and we are even taking it on outings more. It is much nicer looking, if one needs a 4-prong. Nice padded handle.
customer_reviews.author: Beckalina

customer_reviews.title: Great quad cane
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife after she had a stroke and was able to stand and start taking steps. She has been using it for about a month now and it has been great. It’s stable and sturdy and light weight enough where it doesn’t wear her arm out. And it was a great price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kilburn

customer_reviews.title: At 6'3" it's hard to find a cane that fits well... This one goes all the way!
customer_reviews.text: It's so nice to use this one. it checks all my boxes of needs in a cane. nice and sturdy, and always stays where I leave it. No more trying to retrieve my cane off of the floor or ground and loosing balance! Uneven ground takes a little getting use to compared to a single foot, but well worth the practice and paying attention. So great not to to worry about dropping it when I need a second hand for something I'm doing.
customer_reviews.author: Jarhead N Auntie

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great value!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these and had them delivered to my 91 yr old dad because he'd accidently left his in the store on one of his excursions to get groceries. He loves the fact that now he has two and can leave one in the truck while having one in the house. The price and the quality made this a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Unsteady to Use
customer_reviews.text: Totally unsteady! I couldn’t use this cane at all. It felt like all four legs were a different height, and it rattled even after being tightened.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This quad cane is sturdy and feels hefty to use
customer_reviews.text: This quad cane is sturdy and feels hefty to use. I have others that feel flimsy, but this one feels very supportive. If you need a lot of support, you might want a cane with a bigger base. In my experience, the bigger the base, the greater the support. But the bigger the base, the more the base gets in the way of walking. So so a lot depends on individual needs and mobility.
customer_reviews.author: P. Dudenhefer

customer_reviews.title: so I addd this one to my "cane supply" but don't like it that well
customer_reviews.text: I thought my balance need a little help, so I addd this one to my "cane supply" but don't like it that well. 1 - it is heavy, and 2- it needs a very level place to put it down and walk forward with. I saved it, thinking that I will like it more, later. Not sure, but . . . . .
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Hallmark

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sturdiness and light weight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 80yr old grandfather and he loves it! Perfect for sturdiness and light weight. I'd definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tray

customer_reviews.title: Broken cane
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for an old patient Thts wht happen thanks God she didn’t had severe injuries So disappointed with with this item
customer_reviews.author: nata

customer_reviews.title: Crack in handle.
customer_reviews.text: Upon delivery noticed there is a hairline crack in the handle of my beautiful new cane. Very sad and disappointed . The box was huge this came in so I think going to post office and sending back with my disability not going to happen .
customer_reviews.author: sally21

customer_reviews.title: Stable and unattractive
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably sturdy and stable. I would have been more attractive without the company advertising painted permanently on the stem of the cane. Makes it look more medical than personal. I would not call it light weight, but it does provide support.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 91 year old mother, and she has been very satisfied with it. It is sturdy, and still lightweight enough for her to use easily. It gives her the stability she needs to feel more confident in moving around. (And she loves the rose color.)
customer_reviews.author: NCGirl

customer_reviews.title: Can't take advantage of extra stability if the feet aren't level
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this for my mother as she's had hip replacement surgery. We had a cane already but it was traditional, so I wanted her to have a cane with this design for more stability. However, it simply isn't level. It teeters back and forth and she's having difficulty being confident in putting her weight on it lest it tip one way or the other and throw her balance off. Can't recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Smith

customer_reviews.title: The prongs at the bottom  bent and unstable.
customer_reviews.text: This item made me trip. 2 of the prongs bent suddenly. This is unsafe or a weakness in the metal prongs,
customer_reviews.author: Farbet

customer_reviews.title: Color is beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: Great cane! I love the color thank you, for color and not just black or brown. The bottom of the cane is excellent support, you do not have to worry about it fall over. If you are looking for a stylist cane that is sturdy this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: mskatt

customer_reviews.title: Not helpful
customer_reviews.text: Cane is much heavier than I thought. Almost tripped over legs. Was not helpful with walking. Abandoned it after 4 days because it was too unsteady. Should have returned it before throwing away oversized box. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: mckennly

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: Very unstable. All four posts do not sit flush on the ground. I broke my leg and wasn’t hoping to graduate from my walker to this cane but it’s way too wobbly to support that.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi

customer_reviews.title: A Father's Day gift
customer_reviews.text: It's an excellent quality, safe cane and though my husband wishes he didn't need it, he swears it's been a "lifesaver" and has allowed him to do things he wasn't able to do before. Freedom is priceless. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: SweetSerenity

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My mom loved the pink color which made her more likely to use it in public because she felt it looked less sterile. It was easy to adjust and assemble and she’s found it very helpful for using both out in the community in within the home.
customer_reviews.author: Aleisha

customer_reviews.title: Just Not the Same as Antique Version 'Walked' Out
customer_reviews.text: I had an antique version from someone born 1898 but someone let it 'walk' out while I was recuperating. For my carpal tunnel damaged wrist, it was more comfortable. I dislike the feeling of the rubber grip, a personal quirk.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie O.

customer_reviews.title: WWII Veteran Approved!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my friend who is a 94-year-old WWII veteran as a surprise and he was shocked! It is very sturdy and adjusts to his height easily. His old one didn’t adjust high enough for him, which hurt his back and compromised his balance, and the rubber pads on the bottom came off too easily. This cane is a similar design but much nicer! He has no problem adjusting it himself and it has great balance. It’s also nice that I can find replacement pads for it if I need to. It’s so nice to know that it’s keeping him safe!
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Groff

customer_reviews.title: Very strong, sturdy but a little heavy because of that
customer_reviews.text: Very strong, sturdy but a little heavy because of that. I was irritated to have to upgrade to the 4 prong cane, but after some time, now I feel more confident having it. The color is pretty
customer_reviews.author: Cher A.

customer_reviews.title: Poor, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: While ibis is light weight, it is not sturdy enough for use and mobility. The designed caused it to collapse every time I tried to use it. Returned the product before I caused another injury.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE my new quad cane!!!! And Hugo is a great brand of medical supplies! I wanted to second cane so I can have one upstairs and one downstairs/car. Surprised it came in the beautiful Rose color!!!! Why have a boring silver cane? lol LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: LISA M TESTERMAN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price and REALLY WORKS
customer_reviews.text: Was using a standard cane and frustrated by constant dropping it...This is free standing and the price beats similar I saw in stores...Would be fun to use 2 of these as crutches... Reviewed by cyberplott@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Lott

customer_reviews.title: OK for big hands
customer_reviews.text: This cane seems sturdy and well-enough made. It's pretty heavy, and the hand grip is giving me wrist problems. As an average size woman not good, probably would be OK for a bigger hand, but the grip itself is very hard and uncomfortably shaped, also smelled very bad when cane was newer. Tried to replace the grip with a silicone foam, but the way it's constructed it's not possible to take existing grip off.
customer_reviews.author: Susanne B.

customer_reviews.title: Best cane best price best quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and the stability of this cane is A+! I would highly recommend this cane. The price is unbeatable and the cane is high quality and handle is super comfort grip!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Anne Shope McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Great stability
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad to give him a little more stability when out walking in public. He is 102 years old. He has never had a cane and I was not sure he would use one (he is rather stubborn). He loves this cane and uses it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Standing yoga
customer_reviews.text: I have been practicing yoga for 30 or so yrs. I am 61 now and have been practicing only speraticaly in the last few yrs. Anyway I can not do the one leg standing poses without a support to steady myself. This is perfect and lightweight. Before I was using a chair, but this is much easier to move from side to side and keep up with the video.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Stiles

customer_reviews.title: great assistive device
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mom after a fall. Easily assembled and collapsed, sturdy and adjustable, It has made it possible for her to safely get around. The color and design are both amazing. Having to rely on a device such as this is hard to accept, but when its not of a "medical" look it helps with demeanor and acceptance
customer_reviews.author: lm

customer_reviews.title: Very nice attractive cane.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, feels comfortable in my hand. Color is darker than it appears in picture. Comes with wrist strap. Other than the darker rose color the cane is exactly as pictured. For those who complained about the logo; it is not large, it does appear in the pictures, and does not detract from the stability factor or the fact the handle is comfortable in either hand or the performance of the cane. I own three canes and they all have advertising on them as do my two walkers. If the advertising bothers anyone you can always buy a cane cover right here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: An excellent, sturdy quad, with feet spread just a bit smaller than some, which is a good trait when going up/down stairs. No tripping over the quad feet.
customer_reviews.author: GeezingInVA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 85 year old mom!
customer_reviews.text: My 85 year old mother broke her hip and needed a support device more sturdy than a cane. The Hugo Adjustable Quad Cane is great, adjusted well to her 4'11" height, perfect for around the house or walks to church.
customer_reviews.author: Dan from Chapel Hill, NC

customer_reviews.title: Uneven
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'10 and full figured and it handles my height and weight very well but it's uneven. The 4 floor post aren't even which caused it to wobble.
customer_reviews.author: janicemichelle

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good product. You have to remove the plastic covering on the shaft of the cane to adjust the height (and read the directions). That was hard to get off, but the product is nice.
customer_reviews.author: chica

customer_reviews.title: Great!  I get lots of compliments.
customer_reviews.text: If I have to use one it might as well be pretty. I get compliments on this all the time. And I didn't sacrifice quality for vanity. This is pretty AND stabile!
customer_reviews.author: Gossamer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: We have a plethora of canes. These are the best, by far. Very sturdy and the handgrips are great. Easy to adjust. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RAB - NC

customer_reviews.title: Walking Cane.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect transition from hospital bed to home with walker & now this cane after back surgery. It helps with my balance. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Check for wobble
customer_reviews.text: Can is a bit wobbly. Started to send ot back but needed one right away. Will be looking for another cane.
customer_reviews.author: stacy

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: All four feet do not touch the floor equally. Of balance one off causing some instability No satisfaction because stability is what we ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Unfortunately, it did not provide the stability I need right now. But I do recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Wonder Woman’s Grandmother

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is well made, solid, sturdy. definitely keeps me "upright". the quad legs do a nice job of support. I would recommend this cane.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzlybear

customer_reviews.title: Excellent--Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction. Easily adjusts for height, as well as for left or right handed use. Would order it again, without question.
customer_reviews.author: GoldFalconSix

customer_reviews.title: Like large base better.
customer_reviews.text: I have the large base and it’s more stable. The small base is wobbly, and doesn't feel secure. Not able to use at all.
customer_reviews.author: Agent Provocateur

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend for anyone needing a walking aid. Helped relieve pressure on knee so it could heal. Easy height adjustment, study and great value.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: This is lightweight, but sturdy! The four pegs made this very stable - and the arm itself is adjustable for different heights - but the metal is very strong, yet light - which was perfect for my wife when she broke her leg. The handle is rubber - which was nice, but it might be better if it was foam. The rubber can make your hand hurt when you've used the cane a long time. Didn't really use the wrist strap, though it's nice to know it is there in case you are at risk of dropping this and are unable to squat to pick it up again.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Sportsman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just what the doctor ordered. Using this cane helps with my stability and I do not worry about falling now. Definitely a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. L. PUTMAN

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy cane
customer_reviews.text: The only problem is that it makes dangerous to trip on it. Maybe is good for people with back problems and not legs, knees or feet.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: a little awkward at first, but that goes away. Does the job now. Very strong. Should hold up plenty of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: If you are frail get something lighter
customer_reviews.text: It is heavy to lift it should be lighter there are titanium ones i thought this was on but it is not as far as I can tell it’s heavyweight than I thought it would be still serves a purpose
customer_reviews.author: Rosalee Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Fills the need
customer_reviews.text: As my dad ages (93) he recently became more unstable, this and his old cane wasn't stabilizing enough. He is using this cane and likes that the quad footprint is a smaller one.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Great cane
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite pleased with this. I have another one, different brand, but this one feels sturdier. Using it lends confidence that I am not going to fall.
customer_reviews.author: Corina C.

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to use as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This was not like I thought it would be. You have to be extra careful that all 4 feet are firmly on the surface, I almost fell so be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Works great and very stable
customer_reviews.text: Great cane, works perfect for my mom. Very stable to use. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Catman from Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Just took "Rosie" for a spin during my first trip to NYC. Did an excellent job keeping up with sidewalk flow. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excited!!
customer_reviews.text: I broke my femur bone in March and now I’m so excited about this cane!! Arrived on time and it’s Awesome. This will become my best friend for the next two months.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Willingham

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy yet not heavy
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy without being super heavy. The handle has a nice feel and a good soft but not too soft grip. Would highly recommend this quad cane. The handle is a bonus and comes in quite handy at times.
customer_reviews.author: samnsu

product_meta.title: Hugo Adjustable Quad Cane for Right or Left Hand Use, Black, Small Base
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackQuad canes by Hugo are everything you want in a cane and much more. These height adjustable, black small base quad canes can accommodate most people between 5' - 6'.5" and are durable, versatile and stylish. The Hugo Quad Cane has a shock absorbing cushion-top handle with reflective strap for added night time safety. Hugo Small Base Quad Canes incorporate push buttons to provide 11 precision height settings, supporting up to 300 lbs. The ergonomic cane handle is designed to fit more comfortably in your hand while the K-shaped base provides greater stability and can be rotated for left or right hand use. This Hugo mobility aid is manufactured of heavy-gauge anodized aluminum to provide durability while being light weight. Model # 731-850


Specifications

 * Weight Capacity: 300 lbs.
 * Fits Most People Between: 5' - 6'5"
 * Handle Height Adjustments (handle to floor): 2'4" - 3'3"
 * Item Weight: 2.1 lbs.
 * Assembled Dimensions (open): 1.0" x 1.0" x 28.0"
feature_bullets: This Listing is For Bariatric Quad Canes
Qty : 1 Each. Flared rubber tips for stability and traction
Adjustment height, 29 38" (74 96.5 cm).11 push button height adjustments fit most people 5′ 6’5″ (152 – 198 cm)*

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
